Key Match Events: Shadab Khan's all-round excellence helped keep Pakistan's slim T20 World Cup semi-final hopes alive as they overcame South Africa by 33 runs under the Duckworth-Lewis-Stern method.
Iftikhar Ahmed contributed 51 off 35 balls before Shadab Khan's onslaught of 52 from just 22 deliveries catapulted Pakistan to 185 for nine.
Anrich Nortje took the wicket of Shadab Khan and Mohammad Wasim with his next ball to finish with figures of four for 41.

Shaheen Shah Afridi snared Quinton de Kock and Rilee Rossouw, while Shadab Khan had Temba Bavuma caught behind for 36 off 19 balls before castling Aiden Markram through the gate for 20 off 14 deliveries.
Afridi finished with three for 14 as South Africa limped to 108 for nine to slip to their first defeat of the campaign.
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan's prospects of the last four rest on them seeing off Bangladesh as well as relying on South Africa or India, who take on Zimbabwe at the MCG, to lose.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan triumphed in a rain-affected match at the SCG.
South Africa had slipped to 69 for four after nine overs when a shower reduced their target to 142 from 14 overs.
